intro: Microlicia raymondii, commonly known as the Raymond's microlicia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
